Aztecs.tips: Jaguar Warriors are strong against infantry, so ranged units are your best bet.

units_to_avoid: Arbalests (due to Ratha's high pierce armor)
Bengalis.tips: Rathas are classified as archers, making Skirmishers very effective.

Berbers.tips: Use a mix of units to counter the Berbers' versatile roster.

Bohemians.tips: Treat the Houfnice like a bombard cannon and counter accordingly.

Britons.tips: Use fast cavalry to close the gap and overwhelm Longbowmen.

Bulgarians.tips: Konniks are strong in melee, so a combined arms approach is best.

Burgundians.tips: Similar to Konniks, use a mix of Halberdiers and ranged units.

Burmese.tips: Arambai excel at close range, so keep your distance and use ranged units.

Byzantines.tips: Use Monks to convert Cataphracts or focus on ranged units with high pierce armor.

Celts.tips: Woad Raiders are fast but fragile, so prioritize units with high damage output.

Chinese.tips: Chu Ko Nus have limited range, so outrange them with siege or massed archers.

Cumans.tips: Kipchaks excel against cavalry, so stick to ranged units and siege.

Dravidians.tips: Urumi Swordsmen are weak to range, while Thirisadai are vulnerable to specialized ships.

Ethiopians.tips: Shotel Warriors are fast but squishy, so prioritize units with high damage output.

Franks.tips: Throwing Axemen are vulnerable to ranged units, especially those with high pierce armor.

Goths.tips: Use Monks early on, then transition to heavy units to counter massed Huskarls.

Gurjaras.tips: Use a mix of units to counter the Gurjaras' unique strengths.

Hindustanis.tips: Ghulams excel against light infantry and ranged units, so prioritize heavily armored units.

Huns.tips: Tarkans have high pierce armor, so use melee units or Monks to counter them.

Incas.tips: Keep your distance from Kamayuks and use ranged units to take them down.

Italians.tips: Italians have strong ranged units, so a mix of Skirmishers and heavy units is recommended.

Japanese.tips: Samurais are vulnerable to ranged attacks, especially those with high pierce armor.

Khmer.tips: Use Monks to convert Ballista Elephants or a mix of Monks and Halberdiers to overwhelm them.

Koreans.tips: Koreans have strong ranged units, so a mix of Monks, cavalry, and siege is recommended.

Lithuanians.tips: Leitis are powerful against cavalry, so prioritize ranged units or Monks.

Magyars.tips: Magyar Huszars are strong against siege, so use heavy cavalry or Halberdiers to counter them.

Malay.tips: Karambit Warriors are strong in melee, so use heavy units or massed archers to counter them.

Malians.tips: Gbetos are fast and have high damage output, so keep your distance and use ranged units.

Mayans.tips: Mayans lack Redemption and Bombard Cannon, making Siege Onagers and Scorpions very effective.

Mongols.tips: Mangudai are strong against cavalry and infantry, so prioritize ranged units.

Persians.tips: Use the classic Halberdier and Monk combination to counter War Elephants.

Poles.tips: Obuchs are strong in melee, so use ranged units to counter them. Winged Hussars are vulnerable to massed archers and Halberdiers.

Portuguese.tips: Portuguese rely on their powerful late-game units. Pressure them early on and use the recommended counters to deal with their unique strengths.

Romans.tips: Legionaries are similar to Champions, while Centurions are strong in melee and best countered by Monks or heavy units.

Saracens.tips: Mamelukes can be overwhelming in large numbers, so prioritize Arbalests or a mix of Monks and Halberdiers.

Sicilians.tips: Serjeants have low DPS, so use heavy units or massed archers to overwhelm them.

units_to_avoid: Most Melee Units (except Halberdiers and Heavy Camels)
Slavs.tips: Boyars are strong against most melee units, so prioritize Halberdiers or Heavy Camels.

Spanish.tips: Conquistadors are vulnerable to Skirmishers, while Missionaries are weak to fast units.

Tatars.tips: Keshiks are strong against cavalry, so use Halberdiers or Heavy Camels. Flaming Camels are vulnerable to ranged attacks.

Teutons.tips: Teutonic Knights are very strong in melee, so prioritize ranged units or heavy siege.

Turks.tips: Janissaries are powerful but vulnerable to ranged units with high pierce armor.

Vietnamese.tips: Rattan Archers have high pierce armor, making them resistant to ranged attacks. Use heavy siege or overwhelm them with melee units.

Vikings.tips: Berserks are vulnerable to ranged units, while Longboats are generally strong but can be countered by specific unique units.
